alert.note: Alert for Bell; Clay; Knox; Laurel; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 7:22PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, Bell, Knox, Whitley and southern Clay Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 722 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rockholds, or 7 miles northeast of Williamsburg, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wilton, Moore Hill and Louden around 725 PM EDT. Indian Creek, Dishman Springs, Permon, Arkle, Rossland, Bertha Station, Clate, King, Gray and Bryants Store around 730 PM EDT. Barbourville, Emmanuel, Heidrick, Lowell, Baileys Switch, Bentley Station, Swanpond, Garrich, Swan Lake and Hubbs around 735 PM EDT. Hinkle, Cannon, Yeager, Bimble, Girdler, Baughman, Boone Heights, Green Road, Jarvis and Artemus around 740 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Barnyard, Hammond, Dewitt, Scalf, Walker, Salt Gum, Fount, Old Flat Lick, Mills and Haven. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 1 and 33. U.S. Highway 25 East in Bell County between mile markers 1 and 18. U.S. Highway 25 East in Knox County between mile markers 1 and 26. U.S. Highway 25 East in Laurel County between mile markers 0 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
